alert.note: Alert for Edgecombe; Halifax; Nash; Sampson; Warren; Wayne; Wilson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 09 at 3:25PM EDT until July 09 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM EDT FOR WAYNE...EASTERN WARREN...NORTHEASTERN NASH...SAMPSON... EDGECOMBE...HALIFAX AND EASTERN WILSON COUNTIES... At 323 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 13 miles southwest of Halifax to 8 miles northwest of Farmville to 11 miles south of Clinton, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. Goldsboro recently measured a wind gust of 52 mph. The line also has a history of producing extensive wind damage. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Rocky Mount, Goldsboro, Roanoke Rapids, Tarboro, Clinton, Halifax, Wilson, Mount Olive, Scotland Neck and Elm City. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Straight line winds can blow down trees, power lines, and damage mobile homes and other buildings. Seek shelter in a sturdy structure until the storm has passed. Stay away from windows as flying debris generated by damaging winds can be deadly. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Edgecombe; Halifax; Nash; Sampson; Warren; Wayne; Wilson
